result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:06 PM Defendant Mark DeSean Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Mark DeSean Brown.  Attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for State of Wisconsin. Testimony of Officer Kilpatrick. State rests. No witnesses by Defense. Court makes findings, finds probable cause, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Further proceedings on November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Mark DeSean Brown appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Mark DeSean Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Counsel advises was appointed yesterday and has not met with client. Counsel requests preliminary hearing within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

No contact with addresses listed in the complaint. Not to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. No contact with KKDC. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:07 PM Defendant Mark DeSean Brown appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Mark DeSean Brown as a friend of the Court.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Counsel waives reading and provides updated address. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $50,000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests low cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
